::Prowl::

The Maximal's optics were still in the proccess of focusing as Prowl 
looks around himself. For a second, he had no idea who he was, or 
what in the Matrix he was doing laying in a big green field, but then 
memories started to come back to him.

His name was Prowl, or at least that's what he remembered. He was a 
strategic adviser for the Maximals, as well as a fighter.

How he ended up on this green field was still a mistery, at least for 
the time being. Prowl shakily gets to his feet, his head feeling a 
bit lightheaded. It was as if he was still half asleep, or perhaps 
half dead. If only the feathered Maximal knew how close to the truth 
that was....

Prowl stretches and sighs. He couldn't remember anything beyond his 
name and function. The Maximal gives a command to access his data 
tracks again, a huge flood of memories suddenly rushing back at him.

His name was indeed Prowl, and he was indeed a Maximal strategist and 
warrior. But his other memories came back as well: him enlisting in 
Maximal service, him and Striker and the group going on different 
missions, his life, his home...

Cybertron.... Memories flooded back to him, memories of missions he'd 
gone on, bots he'd met. He could see himself in a conference room, 
the conference room of the ship on which he had arrived on earth, 
explaining a plan to the assembled bots, Striker's group. He 
remembered old friends, family, and finally, one face that stood out 
above all, Iron Raptor...

It was as if that name triggered a whole new wave of memories, but 
these were definetly not his. He could see a strange room coming into 
focus, a bit slanted due to the position of the bot through whose 
optics he was looking. Wires were attatched to different places of 
the bot on the slanted sheet of metal. There were two screens in the 
room, one of them displaying a velociraptor and the other one a 
strange alien shape. Prowl recognized the shape as Iron Raptor's 
second beast mode.

He was seeing her memories, or at least the key ones. He could now 
see the face of a small bot, a mere child, able to hear Iron Raptor's 
voice talking to it, explaining something.

More memories flashed through his mind, one particular one catching 
his eye. It was the first time he and Iron Raptor had kissed, but now 
seen through her prospective. He could tell she had been nervious and 
even a little scared, but before he could figure out more, more 
memories flashed before his eyes. Battles against the Alliance, 
fights with the Predacons, his and her passions in her quarters at 
the Ark...

Shaking his head to settles the memories a bit, Prowl looks around 
himself. He couldn't see Iron Raptor, but he remembered making a deal 
for her to live...

Turning around, Prowl's eyes locate Iron Raptor's sleeping form, his 
mouth opening slightly in wonder. She was beautiful, there was no 
lesser word to describe her.

As usual, his love for her was flooding him, but there was something 
else too. He could feel the emotions flowing from her as well: peace, 
restfullness, love, many different others, all mixed up and flowing 
from her to him. And just as he stood there, sorting through her 
emotions, he somehow knew that the same thing was happening to her: 
she was getting all the wonder, love, admiration that he was feeling 
for her, along with his many memories.

Prowl kneels down in front of her, studying her beautiful face, 
careful not to make a sound, as not to distract her.

If he wasn't so facinated by her that he wasn't unable to notice 
anything else, he might have realized that his body had changed as 
well. The owl head that made up his chest plate in robot mode was 
much more rigid, approaching the look of a raptor's head. His talons, 
which had served as his feet, were now replaced by raptor claws. His 
feathers still covered him, but ended at the ankles, leaving the 
scales to cover his feet. Even if the scales were not visible in 
other places, they covered most of his body, under the feathers. He 
was slightly taller and heavier, and had a slightly heavier build. 
The wings on his back were longer, the mounted orbs on them standing 
out alot more clearly.
